newsitem.title: DUBAI: Tracor Aerospace and Saudi AEC in deals.
newsitem.headline: Tracor Aerospace and Saudi AEC in deals.

text.p: Tracor Aerospace, a unit of Tracor Inc, and the Saudi-based economic offset company Advanced Electronics Co have entered into licensing agreements for AEC to make and sell chaff and flare countermeasures, AEC said.
In a statement, AEC said the agreements cover RR-170 and RR-180 chaff and MJU-7, MJU-10 and M-206 flare expendables used on F-5, F-15, F-16, C-130 and other aircraft and helicopters.

"The 10 year agreements provide AEC with exclusive manufacturing rights in Saudi Arabia and exclusive sales rights in the GCC. It is expected the regional sales will exceed $30 million over the next five years," it said.
The GCC (Gulf Cooperation Council) is made up of Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar and Bahrain.
Chaff countermeasures are strands of radar reflective material which create a diversionary target for attacking missiles and other radar-guided threats, AEC said.
Flare countermeasures are pieces of heat-emitting material which, when ejected from an aircraft, create a diversionary target for infra-red-guided threats.
Under the agreements, AEC will use equipment supplied by Tracor to make and customise products in Riyadh.
"It is estimated that the Gulf region has a combined total of over 800 tactical fighters, cargo aircraft and helicopters that utilise countermeasures," the statement said.
The AEC-Tracor agreements are subject to final review and approval by the companies' respective governments, it said.
